articles.author: Stuart Layt
articles.title: Odd (and even) suggestion for easing restrictions using house numbers - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Researchers from Australia and the UK have suggested using people's house numbers to stagger a post-pandemic return to offices.
articles.content:
Under the plan, those with odd-numbered houses would go to work on odd-numbered days, and even-numbered residents on even-numbered days.
Professor Barnett and his colleagues argue that rather than being too simplistic, the idea is easy to remember and has al… [+2089 chars]

articles.author: Lucy Quaggin
articles.title: Coronavirus in Victoria: Second aged care facility worker tests positive for COVID-19 - 7NEWS.com.au
articles.description: The employee is a close contact of someone from the Cedar Meats outbreak.
articles.content:
A second aged care facility employee has tested positive for COVID-19 in Melbournes Footscray.
Health Minister Jenny Mikakos said the person was a close contact of someone from the Cedar Meats outbreak.
The worker is employed at Doutta Galla Aged Care Home … [+744 chars]

articles.title: Get ready for the 'post-COVID' office - Ballina Shire Advocate
articles.description: Say goodbye to the cookie jar, hot-desking and endless meetings. Aussies will soon start heading back to work – but the office will never be the same.
articles.content:
No more shared cookie jars, fewer meetings, staggered start times and temperature checks before you leave the house - Aussies may be heading back to work, but the office will never be the same.
On the plus side, hot-desking will likely be a thing of the past… [+7549 chars]
